docs.lead_paragraph: ALL five of her children chew organic bubble gum, drink distilled water and use DEET-free bug repellent, so when a neighbor's lawn service started spraying sheets of pesticide that she said billowed across her property line, it's no wonder that Lauren Nannariello was incensed. ''The stuff was flying into my yard and onto the kids' jungle gym, and it was being sprayed by guys with face masks, like a nuclear attack,'' said Mrs. Nannariello, 37, who uses an organic-based lawn service, Nature's Rain, on her hilly 1.1 acre property in West Harrison.
docs.snippet: Homeowners in Westchester adore their green grass, but growing numbers of residents are passionately opposed to the use of lawn pesticides.

multimedia.credit: Lauren Nannariello,with her son Frankie,has an all-organicservice tend to herlawn, and has tried topersuade her neighborsto follow suit.
